title: UK entrepreneur: the story of Sahar Hashemi
text: Sahar Hashemi OBE is a serial entrepreneur and business adviser famous for co-founding and building up the Coffee Republic chain of coffee shops. Together with her brother, Bobby, she developed the business between 1995 and 2001 to well over 100 shops and a £30 million turnover. In 2005, having exited Coffee Republic, Hashemi launched Skinny Candy, a range of low-fat and sugar-free sweets and chocolates. Hashemi has published two books, Anyone Can Do It , published in 2003 and Switched On , which hit bookshelves in 2010. Businesses should stay creative and innovative if they are to remain relevant Today, she works to instil entrepreneurial habits in large businesses, making them more agile, innovative and forward-thinking. Central to this work is the belief that businesses should stay creative and innovative if they are to remain relevant. Hashemi is a supporter of the Prince’s Trust, sits on the NSPCC Corporate Development Board and is a patron of Child Bereavement UK. She was awarded an OBE in 2012 for services to the UK economy. • Win a state-of-the-art Canon printer for your SME »
